text:
Raskolnikov stepped outside, feeling a surge of confidence. 

“Now we’ll make a fight for it,” he whispered, grinning maliciously. 

He descended the stairs, shame gnawing at him. 

“Cowardice,” he muttered, recalling his past. 

The world felt heavy, yet he walked on. 

Each step echoed his resolve.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov leaves the room feeling more confident and maliciously self-reflective about his cowardice.
